rosas.lou.calculator
Class RunTime

java.lang.Object
  rosas.lou.calculator.RunTime
public class RunTime
extends java.lang.Object

The RunTime Class by Lou Rosas. This Class encapsulates the time data used by the Pace Calculator This class takes time data in either integer or String format and saves off the data locally in the following format: Hours: integer Minites: integer Seconds: double: in Seconds.decimal

getTime

public RunTime getTime()

getTimeInHours

public double getTimeInHours()
Return the total time in hours. This method returns the time in hours in the form of: hr.decimal hours This is done by the following formula: hours + minutes/60 + seconds/3600 i.e 3 hours 30 minutes 0 seconds would be converted to 3.5 hours

getTimeInMinutes

public double getTimeInMinutes()
Return the total time in minutes. This method returns the time in minutes in decimal form: minutes.decimal minutes. This is done by the following formula: hours/60 + minutes+ seconds*60.

getTimeInSeconds

public double getTimeInSeconds()
Return the total time in secods. This method returns the time in seconds in decimal form: seconds.decimal seconds. This is done by the following formula: hours*3600 + minutes*60 + seconds.

setTime

public void setTime(int hrs,
                    int mins,
                    double sec)
             throws RunTimeFormatException
Set the attributes for this object. Given hours, minutes and seconds, set the appropriate instance attributes.

Throws:
RunTimeFormatException

setTime

public void setTime(double time,
                    short format)
             throws RunTimeFormatException
Covert and then set the attributes for this object Given a time value and a format, set the hours, minutes and seconds. Based on the format, the value will be converted to integer hours, integer minutes and decimal seconds.

Throws:
RunTimeFormatException

setTime

public void setTime(RunTime runTime)
             throws RunTimeFormatException
Set the time using another RunTime Object Similar to the Copy Constructor. The time instance attributes are set based on an input

Throws:
RunTimeFormatException

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Override the toString() method This will round the the seconds to the thousandths, add a zero if the minutes and seconds are less than 10, print the hours values only if it is greater than 0 and put in the format: hh:mm:ss.ss.
